Savannah Guthrie apologizes for her live 'Today' show swear

Show Caption Hide Caption Savannah Guthrie comments on cursing on live TV NBC's Today Show host Savannah Guthrie is making the most of things after accidentally swearing on live TV. Nathan Rousseau Smith has the latest. Buzz60

Yes, Savannah your microphone is definitely working.

Today show host Savannah Guthrie took to Twitter Wednesday to apologize for accidentally swearing on live TV, when she wasn't aware that her microphone was working. (Her utterance rhymes with "kit." We'll let your imagination take it from there.)

"Check, check, is this thing on?" Guthrie wrote, pretending to test her mike. "So sorry, guys. Thanks for being kind and understanding. And guess it's a good thing I don't wear a mic all day."

She signed off with the live TV-appropriate hashtag: #ohdarn.

More: Savannah Guthrie and Hoda Kotb on NBC's 'Today,' their Olympics trip and Matt Lauer

Check, check - is this thing on?

Yeah I guess it is.



So sorry guys. Thanks for being kind and understanding. And guess it’s good thing I don’t wear a mic all day. #ohdarn — Savannah Guthrie (@SavannahGuthrie) March 28, 2018

It was saltier language that was on display during the Wednesday morning broadcast when a seemingly unaware Guthrie swore (the clip below above has offending word bleeped).

Guthrie didn't appear to know that she was on camera as she examined papers at her desk and may not have even known the swear went out live at first.

But she did kindly apologize to the sound guys right away, saying, "Sorry guys."
